DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: CAVALLARI, M. R.;Cavallari, M.R.;CAVALLARI, MARCO R.;CAVALLARI, MARCO ROBERTO

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Desde 2019, Marco Roberto Cavallari atua como Professor Doutor com dedicao exclusiva em Engenharia de Energia na Universidade Federal da Integrao Latino-Americana (UNILA). Em 2007, obteve um duplo-diploma franco-brasileiro por ter sido estudante de intercmbio pelo Programa T.I.M.E. (Top Industrial Managers for Europe) na Ecole Centrale de Lille, Frana, tendo estudado tambm Engenharia Eltrica - Sistemas Eletrnicos na Escola Politcnica da Universidade de So Paulo (EPUSP). Em 2010, finalizou seu mestrado de 24 meses na rea de Microeletrnica, cujas atividades experimentais foram parcialmente realizadas na EPUSP e na Fondazione Bruno Kessler/Universit degli Studi di Trento, Itlia. Em 2014, concluiu seu doutorado de 48 meses em OTFTs atuando como sensores de amnia e acetona em diagnsticos mdicos. Em 2019, encerrou sua pesquisa de ps-doutorado em Microeletrnica no Departamento de Engenharia Eltrica da Columbia University em Nova Iorque (EUA) e de Sistemas Eletrnicos da EPUSP. O tema principal de sua pesquisa a fabricao e caracterizao de biossensores a partir de transistores orgnicos (OTFTs). Tem experincia na rea de Engenharia Eltrica com nfase em Microeletrnica e Eletrnica Molecular, atuando nos seguintes temas: caracterizao do transporte de cargas eltricas em slidos desordenados, clulas solares orgnicas, transistores orgnicos de filmes finos (OTFTs), processos de fabricao em microeletronica (CMOS) e Nano and Micro Electromechanical Systems (NEMS/MEMS), nanotecnologia, polmeros conjugados e pequenas molculas orgnicas. Caracteriza-se por um pensamento analtico e com foco em resultados, criatividade, carter comunicativo, capacidade de trabalhar sob presso, facilidade de aprendizado e de adaptao a novas situaes, motivao para explicar as suas idias, autodidata.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
Since 2019, Marco Roberto Cavallari is a Full-Professor at the Energy Engineering Department of the Federal University for Latin-America Integration (UNILA), Brazil. He teaches Analog and Digital Electronics, Digital Signal Processing and Power Electronics. His main research topic is the processing and characterization of biosensors from an array of organic thin-film transistors (OTFTs).
In 2007, at the end of his graduation studies in Brazil, he obtained a double degree in engineering in Brazil and France for his participation to the T.I.M.E. program (Top Industrial Managers for Europe) in Ecole Centrale de Lille, France, and Department of Electrical Engineering - Electronics Systems (EPUSP, Brazil). In 2010, he finished a 24-month Master of Science in Microelectronics at EPUSP and in Fondazione Bruno Kessler/Universit degli Studi di Trento, Italy. In 2014, he presented his PhD thesis in OTFTs as sensors for clinical diagnosis. In 2017, he finished a 24-month post-doctoral research at the Department of Electrical Engineering in Columbia University, New York. In 2019, he finished a 36-month post-doctoral research at EPUSP.
He is experienced in electrical engineering, specially in Microelectronics and Molecular Electronics, acting in the following fields: characterization of electrical charge transport in disordered solids, organic photovoltacs, organic thin-film transistors (OTFT), chemical sensors for gas sensing, X-ray sensors, strain gauges, processing in microelectronics (CMOS) and Micro Electromechanical Systems (MEMS), nanotechnology, piezoelectric materials, conjugated polymers and small organic molecules.

Specialties: electronic devices characterization (sensors, diodes, LEDs, solar cells, transistors, circuits), programming (ASP, HTML, Java, Java Server Pages, Javascript, Assembly, C, C++, VHDL, Matlab), modeling (Pspice, Microstation, Catia CAD), languages (English, French, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Russian)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Pesquisa e desenvolvimento de dispositivos eletroluminescentes com polmeros semicondutores
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O tema central estudo das propriedades e fabricao de dispositivos eletroluminescentes (LEDs) baseados em materiais polimricos semicondutores. Um dos principais problemas a serem abordados o do processo de degradao da camada polimrica. O processo de degradao complexo, porm sabemos que a causa das falhas prematuras se deve, principalmente, ao do oxignio e do vapor de gua presentes nos dispositivos e que tem origem no seu processamento em ambiente no controlado. A possibilidade de semicondutores polimricos serem sintetizados para emisso em diversos comprimentos de onda estimulou o interesse em desenvolver "displays" monocromticos e coloridos que podem ser produzidos tanto em substratos de vidro, semelhana de "displays" de cristal lquido, ou sobre substratos flexveis de material polimrico.

O processo de degradao complexo, porm sabemos que a causa das falhas prematuras se deve, principalmente, ao do oxignio e do vapor de gua presentes nos dispositivos e que tem origem no seu processamento em ambiente no controlado. PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-UNIDADE: Departamento de Engenharia de Sistema Eletrnicos

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento transistores de filmes finos orgnicos que possibilitem o uso como sensores para deteco de analitos em fase vapor ou em fase lquida. Foram aplicados, principalmente, politiofenos comerciais, sendo o estudo composto por uma etapa de investigao dos fatores ligados sua degradao, alm do detalhamento da sensibilidade e especificidade de cada sensor em resposta a um conjunto de analitos. Este projeto tambm abordou fatores que prejudicam o funcionamento do dispositivo flexionado em susbtratos flexveis mecanicamente, buscando assim minimizar os problemas causados pela toro do dispositivo.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Projeto e Desenvolvimento de Novos Mtodos para Microgerao de Energia atravs da Captao de Energias Residuais (Energy Harvesting)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A pesquisa proposta consiste na utilizao de Materiais termoeltricos (TEGs) para o desenvolvimento de Microgerador de Estado Slido para Captao de Energias Trmicas Residuais atravs da Termoeletricidade aplicados a veculos a combusto. Os TEGs so materiais capazes de converter gradiente de temperatura (delta T) diretamente em energia eltrica sem partes girantes atravs do fenmeno conhecido como efeito Seebeck. De acordo com o princpio da conservao de energia que estabelece que a quantidade total de energia em um sistema isolado permanece constante, o aproveitamento de parte da energia desperdiada (perdas) pode ser recuperada e utilizada no prprio local gerador do desperdcio. Consequentemente, ao reaproveitar parte desta energia residual ir se maximizar o rendimento do sistema como um todo. Logo, com o desenvolvimento do microgerador de estado slido ser possvel reaproveitar as energias residuais de processos industriais. Como por exemplo, processos de forjamento e conformao, sistemas de refrigerao industrial, caldeiras, fornos cermicos bem como o calor desperdiado pelo motor de um carro pode ser convertido em eletricidade para carregar as baterias.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: PROJETO GREEN PARK (Parque de diverso que gera energia limpa)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O PROJETO GREEN PARK (Parque de diverso que gera energia limpa) consiste em aes temticas integradoras que visam a produo e desenvolvimento de um conjunto de materiais e experimentos didticos (baixo custo) para ensinar de forma ldica, interativa e intuitiva a importncia dos agentes para promover a sustentabilidade. O objetivo apresentar e discutir as caractersticas de um projeto de pesquisa, ensino e extenso universitria que prioriza o desenvolvimento de um parque de diverso que gera energia limpa (Green Park) para ensinar de forma ldica, interativa e intuitiva a importncia dos agentes para promover a sustentabilidade e consequentemente a construo de materiais didticos com vista a subsidiar o ensino na Educao Bsica em laboratrio dos contedos de cincias e engenharias aplicados no Green Park. O projeto ainda propem produo de recursos didticos para prtica de projetos interdisciplinares a fim de possibilitar a nossa reflexo sobre a importncia de projetos dessa natureza nos processos de formao inicial de professors e aos alunos do ensino fundamental, bem como, obter dados seguros para promover melhorias na metodologia aplicada visando uma futura expanso. Por fim, destaca-se que os diversos materiais a serem desenvolvidos passam a fazer parte do acervo da Estao Cincia onde sero utilizados por professores (em formao inicial e continuada) que atuam no ensino bsico de escolas da rede pblica e privada da regio da trplice fronteira. O presente projeto faz parte do programa SAVE (Sol, gua, Vida e Energia) pois ECOnomizar tambm coisa de Criana

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: GPEnSE - Grupo de Pesquisa em Energia e Sustentabilidade Energtica
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Quem Somos? O GPENSE um grupo de pesquisa vinculado ao Instituto Latino-Americano de Tecnologia, Infraestrutura e Territrio (ILATIT) da Universidade Federal da Integrao Latino-Americana (UNILA) compostos por Pesquisadores e Estudantes que renem seus esforos e conhecimentos em prol do desenvolvimento tcnico e cientifico em benefcio da Educao, Cincia e Tecnologia. Misso O GPEnSE visa atravs da sinergia entre a Comunidade Cientifica e a Industria contribuindo para o desenvolvimento na Regio da Trplice Fronteira por meio de Pesquisas e Produes tcnicas e cientficas aplicadas ao Setor Eltrico e Industrial da Amrica Latina.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Monitoria Remota em EER0127 - Acionamentos do perodo 2020.5 do Curso de Engenharia de Energia
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
A monitoria em EER0127 - Acionamentos do perodo 2020.5 se faz necessria para acompanhamento da realizao das atividades por parte dos alunos, monitoramento dos fruns e auxlio utilizao de software de simulao de circuitos eletrnicos. Alm disso, tal estudante servir de auxlio ao docente em um momento que atravessamos uma pandemia de COVID-19, mas que, porm, precisamos retornar s aulas pouco a pouco.

O monitor selecionado desenvolver competncias de comunicao oral e escrita atravs da participao em fruns, chats e aulas. Aprofundar seus conhecimentos em Eletrnica de Potncia ao verificar os materiais divulgados e interagir com os discentes. 

Os discentes matriculados no curso sero beneficiados por um acompanhamento mais rgido do contedo disponibilizado e das atividades realizadas.

Uma melhor aprendizagem nesta disciplina por parte do monitor e dos discentes matriculados fundamental para uma correta aplicao de conhecimentos de Circuitos Eltricos e Eletrnica durante a carreira de engenheiros formados no curso de Engenharia de Energia. A disciplina de Acionamentos responsvel pelo controle e gesto da energia eltrica gerada em uma usina (e.g. geradores), assim como a empregada para alimentar mquinas eltricas (e.g. motores). Todos os docentes que tenham interesse em aplicar a gesto ou controle da energia eltrica em suas disciplinas de graduao ou ps-graduao, seus projetos de pesquisa ou extenso, colhero os frutos de discentes mais preparados para o enriquecimento das atividades a serem realizadas.

Neste contexto, o monitor constitui-se em apoio fundamental para aferio de conhecimento e levantamento de dvidas apresentadas na avaliao de situaes/problema e resoluo de exerccios de aplicao especfica.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Dispositivos eletrnicos flexveis a partir de filmes finos orgnicos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A importncia da pesquisa em Eletrnica Orgnica (EO) surge a partir da previso de que alcanamos o limite de reduo das dimenses e integrao dos dispositivos. Se comparada microeletrnica inorgnica tradicional baseada principalmente no silcio, a EO destaca-se por oferecer inmeros semicondutores e tcnicas de deposio de baixo custo e em grande superfcie. Os Transistores de Filmes Finos Orgnicos (OTFTs, do ingls Organic Thin-Film Transistors) so a unidade fundamental em circuitos eletrnicos. Podem ser fabricados sobre substratos plsticos de baixo custo e oferecem grande nmero de aplicaes como: mostradores flexveis, etiquetas de identificao por rdio freqncia, eletrnica txtil e sensoriamento. Alm disso, h demanda por componentes pequenos, portteis e baratos, principalmente com aplicaes em diagnsticos mdicos in-situ, monitoramento ambiental e de alimentos, aplicao de frmacos, deteco de armas qumicas e biolgicas, e para confeco de lnguas e narizes eletrnicos. Neste contexto, o objetivo do presente projeto o desenvolvimento de componentes eletrnicos a base de OTFTs. A principal inovao consiste, principalmente, na aplicao em eletrnica de novos materiais desenvolvidos por nossos colaboradores.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Research in Organic Electronics (OE) has become mandatory from the prediction that mankind has reached the limit in dimension scaling and device integration. Furthermore, if compared to the already-established inorganic microelectronics based on silicon, OE can offer countless semiconductors and low-cost deposition techniques over large area flexible substrates. Organic Thin-Film Transistors (OTFTs) are the base blocks of electronic circuits and, usually, present a field-effect device structure. Due to its easy processability, these devices offer innumerous applications, such as flexible displays, radio-frequency identification tags, textile electronics and sensors (e.g. chemical, biological and pressure). Besides, there is a demand for small, portable and cheap gadgets, mainly for in-situ medical diagnosis, environmental and food monitoring, drug delivery, chemical and biological weapons detection, and for the confection of electronic noses and tongues. In this context, the objective of this project lies in the development of electronic components from organic thin films, as sensors and transistors. The innovation consists in the application in electronics of semiconductors synthesized and provided from our scientific collaborators.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Cross-linked polyvinyl phenol as dielectric for flexible bottom gate bottom contact transistors

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2019 34th Symposium on Microelectronics Technology and Devices (SBMicro)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 2019 34th Symposium on Microelectronics Technology and Devices (SBMicro)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Polyvinyl phenol with a cross-linker agent was demonstrated as a dielectric film and incorporated to a bottom gate organic transistor structure. Films were shown transparent to visible light, resistant to organic solvents and compatible with plasma etching to open vias. Only cross-linked films, however, withstood lithography in order to pattern bottom contact electrodes on top of the dielectric. Cross-linked films showed a dielectric constant of ca. 5, which is higher than polymethylmethacrylate and silicon oxide. The devices herein have potential to be applied in flexible sensor arrays from organic transistors.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Polyvinyl phenol with a cross-linker agent was demonstrated as a dielectric film and incorporated to a bottom gate organic transistor structure. The devices herein have potential to be applied in flexible sensor arrays from organic transistors.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Organic and Hybrid Sensors and Bioelectronics XIII

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Instrumentao para Medida e Controle de Radiao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The development of solid-state radiation dosimeters has been crucial in allowing human workers to thrive while using tools that output ionizing radiation. Here, we report on solid-state tissue-equivalent radiation dosimeters based on PEDOT:PSS. We show reliable measurements of the radiation dosimeters subjected to a wide range of exposure energies and footprints of both X-ray and gamma. In addition, there is a strong indication that the PEDOT:PSS-based devices also give response when introduced to neutron sources. This represents a significant step forward in the production of cheap, reusable radiation dosimeters made with materials of similar radiation cross-section to the human body.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2020 IEEE International Conference on Flexible and Printable Sensors and Systems (FLEPS)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 2020 IEEE International Conference on Flexible and Printable Sensors and Systems (FLEPS)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: During surgical procedures where navigation stylets are used to place surgical tools, the stylets are tracked as a rigid entity. However, when body tissue applies force to the stylet tip, the stylet bends and the tip location is lost. Tracking the stylet?s bending and tip displacement can enhance the precision of surgical procedures such as catheter placement for external ventricular drainage. In this work, a flexible strain sensor is integrated at the base of a 1.3 mm diameter surgical navigation stylet. The device tracks the stylet?s bending and tip displacement in two orthogonal directions. Using a cantilever beam model to fit the stylet deflection, the device?s measurable tip displacement range is between 1 and 11 mm with a limit of detection of 750 μm.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Optical and Thin Film Approaches to Mechanical Sensing
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Optical and Thin Film Approaches to Mechanical Sensing

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Meeting on Information Display (IMID) 2020

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The ability to intelligently and distinctly sense physical stimuli has manifold applications, requiring a diverse array of sensing mechanisms and platforms tailored to each. Here, a series of novel techniques for mechanical sensing are described in the context of medical and robotic applications.
One application that has found a need for a flexible approach to mechanical sensing is the tracking of a semi- rigid stylet used in the removal of brain tumors in conjunction with a polymeric catheter. The stylet is usually treated as rigid body in tracking software, however significant deflection can occur during movement through the tissue which can result in the misplacement of the catheter and less effective treatment. A series of four serpentine-structured strain gauges on PDMS wrapped around the tip can track the two axes of movement, monitoring the tip deflection in real time, allowing surgeons to more accurately treat brain tumors without damaging the surrounding healthy tissue. The resulting device can measure the tip deflection in two axes with a minimum detectable displacement of 750 μm.[1]
Soft, thin-film mechanical sensors naturally find use in the field of robotics and are particularly well-suited for mimicking the sense of touch in grasping applications. The development of ?e-skin? for robotic hands is a vibrant area of research which finds interest in fields far beyond robotics as well. A tri-modal approach integrated into a soft structure allows for greater adaptability such that these sensors can be placed on arbitrary shapes, but also combines the proximity-sensing capabilities with time of touch and force measurements. A piezoelectric sensor detects the time of touch, a strain sensor as, described earlier, measures the applied force, and a thin-film fringing field capacitance sensor evaluates proximity, all of which retain the flexibility necessary to locate and grasp complex shapes.[2]

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: CAVALLARI, M. R.;Cavallari, M.R.;CAVALLARI, MARCO R.;CAVALLARI, MARCO ROBERTO

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We demonstrate that PECVD SiOxNy with good dielectric properties can replace thermally grown SiO2 in Organic Thin-Film Transistors (OTFT) applications. It can be used on ITO-covered glass or even flexible substrates. Poly [2-methoxy-5-(3?,7?-dimethyloctyloxy)-1,4-phenylenevinylene] (MDMO-PPV) is used as the active layer, due to its wide range of applications such as bulk heterojunction solar cells, light-emitting diodes and light-emitting transistors.We show that charge carrier mobility can be at least two times higher for MDMO-PPV on silicon oxynitride than silicon dioxide, μh 1.1x10-4 cm2/Vs. MDMO-PPV spun from solvents such as chloroform and toluene provide comparable TFT performance on SiOxNy. Preliminary studies of devices with hexamethyldisilazane-treated SiO2 demonstrate that performance can be further improved by the choice of a proper surface treatment.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Oxygen Plasma Surface Treatment onto ITO Surface for OLEDs Based on Europium Complex

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: JICS. JOURNAL OF INTEGRATED CIRCUITS AND SYSTEMS (ED. PORTUGUS)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work, Organic Light-Emitting Diodes (OLEDs) based on Europium (III) complex were studied, especially those with an oxygen plasma surface treatment onto indium tin oxide (ITO) transparent electrode. An OLED with the same thin-film structure but with untreated ITO was fabricated for comparison purposes. Current density-voltage characteristics for treated devices demonstrated an increase from 0.4 to 3.3 mA/cm and a decrease of the turn-on voltage from 28 to 22 V. Additionally, improved hole injection through the transparent electrode impacted on optical response, as luminous efficiency increased from 26 to 44 mcd/A with the advantage of no significant disturb on the europium typical electroluminescence emission spectrum. Emission peak was observed at a wavelength of approximately 614 nm, which is defined by the transition associated with spectroscopic terms (5D0→7D2) and CIE chromaticity coordinates of (0.50;0.36).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Starch-Mediated Immobilization, Photochemical Reduction, and Gas Sensitivity of Graphene Oxide Films
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Starch-Mediated Immobilization, Photochemical Reduction, and Gas Sensitivity of Graphene Oxide Films

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work unveils the roles played by potato starch (ST) in the immobilization, photochemical reduction, and gas sensitivity of graphene oxide (GO) films. The ST/GO films are assembled layer by layer (LbL) onto quartz substrates by establishing mutual hydrogen bonds that drive a stepwise film growth, with equal amounts of materials being adsorbed in each deposition cycle. Afterward, the films are photochemically reduced with UV irradiation (254 nm), following a first-order kinetics that proceeds much faster when GO is assembled along with ST instead of a nonoxygenated polyelectrolyte, namely, poly(diallyl dimethylammonium) hydrochloride (PDAC). Finally, the gas-sensing performance of ST/reduced graphene oxide (RGO) and PDAC/RGO sensors fabricated via LbL atop of gold interdigitated microelectrodes is evaluated at different relative humidity levels and in different concentrations of ammonia, ethanol, and acetone. In comparison to the PDAC/RGO sensor, the ones containing ST are much more sensitive, especially when operating in a high-relative-humidity environment. An array comprising these chemical sensors provides unique electrical fingerprints for each of the investigated analytes and is capable of discriminating and quantifying them in a wide range of concentrations, from 10 to 1000 ppm.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Synthesis and characterization of GO-H3BO3 composite for improving single-sensor impedimetric olfaction
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Synthesis and characterization of GO-H3BO3 composite for improving single-sensor impedimetric olfaction

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Materials Science: Materials in Electronics

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present study shows the synthesis and characterization of graphene oxide (GO) and its composite with boric acid (GO-HBO). Their films were applied to a multi-frequency impedimetric single-sensor olfaction, operating in a high humid environment for human breath diagnoses. The characterization of the composite GO-HBO and bare GO was carried using scanning electronic microscopy (SEM), impedance spectroscopy (IS), structural analysis: XRD, Raman, and elementary analysis: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) and thermogravimetry (TG). The determination of the electronic signatures of the water and aqueous solutions of ethanol or acetone, in the range of 80?640 ppm, was carried out. For that, a single sensor was interrogated sequentially with five different frequencies of the signal probe, inside a headspace system. The matrix of values, of the impedance, capacitance, and phase angle, was analyzed using multivariate PCA statistics. The differential performance of both materials was discussed based on structural and electric properties. Despite the proof-of-concept nature of this study, the whole of its results contributes to the further developments of materials for single-sensor olfaction.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Improved Cyclohexanone Vapor Detection via Gravimetric Sensing
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Improved Cyclohexanone Vapor Detection via Gravimetric Sensing

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Medidas Eltricas, Magnticas e Eletrnicas; Instrumentao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Functionalized gravimetric sensors are a promising path to small, versatile, real-time vapor sensors for volatile organic compounds. Many of these compounds can be dangerous to human health, but their nonreactive nature makes them notoriously difficult to sense. Unlike bulk acoustic resonators, chemiresistive devices have been investigated extensively and many researchers have used innovative synthesis strategies to functionalize these devices. In this work, we demonstrate how modifying a particular sensitizer for use with a bulk acoustic resonator significantly improves the sensitivity of the device (5 ppm vs. 1.11 ppm). Additionally, readout circuitry is described to avoid some problems that typically plague gravimetric sensors while simplifying the overall system. These strategies create a playbook for simple, fast, and sensitive systems for sensing volatile organic compounds, while also demonstrating the lowest limit of detection for cyclohexanone outside of gas chromatography/mass spectrometery in the literature.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Organic Dielectric Films for Flexible Transistors as Gas Sensors
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Organic Dielectric Films for Flexible Transistors as Gas Sensors

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: JICS. JOURNAL OF INTEGRATED CIRCUITS AND SYSTEMS (ED. PORTUGUS)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Cross-linked polymer films with poly(melamine- co-formaldehyde) methylated (PMF) were investigated in order to integrate flexible organic transistor-based sensors. A dielec- tric film that withstands lithography of the electrodes and sem- iconductor deposition is necessary in order to form bottom- gate/bottom-contact thin-film transistors. This device structure makes it possible to fabricate integrated circuits, while exposing the semiconductor to gaseous analytes. For the first time, films from poly(methyl methacrylate) (PMMA) blended with PMF were shown chemically resistant to wet processing. However, thin-films from poly (4-vinylphenol) (PVP) blends with PMF featured lower RMS roughness (0.37 nm) and higher dielectric constant (k ~ 4.7 ? 5.9). The presence of enhanced cross-linking at higher PMF concentrations was confirmed for both polymers from chemical resistance essays, structural characterization, and capacitors with fully-photopatterned electrodes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Organic Thin Film Transistors in Mechanical Sensors
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Organic Thin Film Transistors in Mechanical Sensors

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Eletrnica Industrial, Sistemas e Controles Eletrnicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The marriage of organic thin‐film transistors (OTFTs) and flexible mechanical sensors has enabled previously restricted applications to become a reality. Counterintuitively, the addition of an OTFT at each sensing element can reduce the overall complexity so that large‐area, low‐noise sensors can be fabricated. The best‐performing instance of this is the active matrix, used in display applications for many of the same reasons, and nearly any type of flexible mechanical sensor can be incorporated into these structures. In this Progress Report, some of the flexible sensor devices that have taken advantage of these mechanical properties are highlighted, examining the advantages that OTFTs offer in the hybrid integration of local amplification and switching. In particular, the current research on resistive pressure sensors, capacitive pressure sensors, resistive or piezoresistive strain sensors, and piezoelectric sensors is identified and enumerated.

Counterintuitively, the addition of an OTFT at each sensing element can reduce the overall complexity so that large‐area, low‐noise sensors can be fabricated. The best‐performing instance of this is the active matrix, used in display applications for many of the same reasons, and nearly any type of flexible mechanical sensor can be incorporated into these structures. In this Progress Report, some of the flexible sensor devices that have taken advantage of these mechanical properties are highlighted, examining the advantages that OTFTs offer in the hybrid integration of local amplification and switching. In particular, the current research on resistive pressure sensors, capacitive pressure sensors, resistive or piezoresistive strain sensors, and piezoelectric sensors is identified and enumerated.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Organic Thin-Film Transistors as Gas Sensors: A Review
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Organic Thin-Film Transistors as Gas Sensors: A Review

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Organic thin-film transistors (OTFTs) are miniaturized devices based upon the electronic responses of organic semiconductors. In comparison to their conventional inorganic counterparts, organic semiconductors are cheaper, can undergo reversible doping processes and may have electronic properties chiefly modulated by molecular engineering approaches. More recently, OTFTs have been designed as gas sensor devices, displaying remarkable performance for the detection of important target analytes, such as ammonia, nitrogen dioxide, hydrogen sulfide and volatile organic compounds (VOCs). The present manuscript provides a comprehensive review on the working principle of OTFTs for gas sensing, with concise descriptions of devices? architectures and parameter extraction based upon a constant charge carrier mobility model. Then, it moves on with methods of device fabrication and physicochemical descriptions of the main organic semiconductors recently applied to gas sensors (i.e., since 2015 but emphasizing even more recent results). Finally, it describes the achievements of OTFTs in the detection of important gas pollutants alongside an outlook toward the future of this exciting technology.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Organic thin-film transistors (OTFTs) are miniaturized devices based upon the electronic responses of organic semiconductors. In comparison to their conventional inorganic counterparts, organic semiconductors are cheaper, can undergo reversible doping processes and may have electronic properties chiefly modulated by molecular engineering approaches. More recently, OTFTs have been designed as gas sensor devices, displaying remarkable performance for the detection of important target analytes, such as ammonia, nitrogen dioxide, hydrogen sulfide and volatile organic compounds (VOCs). The present manuscript provides a comprehensive review on the working principle of OTFTs for gas sensing, with concise descriptions of devices? architectures and parameter extraction based upon a constant charge carrier mobility model. Then, it moves on with methods of device fabrication and physicochemical descriptions of the main organic semiconductors recently applied to gas sensors (i.e., since 2015 but emphasizing even more recent results). Finally, it describes the achievements of OTFTs in the detection of important gas pollutants alongside an outlook toward the future of this exciting technology.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.ORGANIZADORES: Alessandra Luzia da Roz, Fbio de Lima Leite, Marystella Ferreira, Osvaldo Novais de Oliveira Jr.
Alessandra L. Da Rz; Marystela Ferreira; Fbio de Lima Leite; Osvaldo N. Oliveira

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
In Micro and Nano Technologies, edited by Alessandra L. Da Rz, Marystela Ferreira, Fbio de Lima Leite and Osvaldo N. Oliveira, William Andrew Publishing, 2017, Nanoscience and its Applications, ISBN 9780323497800, 
Abstract: 
This chapter reviews organic materials from the point of view of application in electronic devices. After presenting techniques for obtaining thin films and thick layers from small organic molecules and polymers to manufacture the devices, the charge transport processes in these organic materials are discussed. Thin film transistors and light-emitting diodes, the main applications presented in this chapter, are discussed regarding configuration, manufacturing, and electrical and optical characterization, as appropriate.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Estrutura de Lquidos e Slidos; Cristalografia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A eletrnica orgnica tornou-se atualmente um importante competidor da eletrnica baseada em silcio amorfo. Uma grande variedade de materiais orgnicos tem sido sintetizada para melhorar o desempenho dos dispositivos eletrnicos. Versatilidade, baixo custo e cobertura de grandes reas so qualidades importantes para aplicaes em telas, painis fotovoltaicos e sensores. A maioria dos polmeros semicondutores so processados por soluo, como o poly(2,5-bis(3-tetradecyl-thiophen-2-yl)thieno[3,2-b]thiophene) (PBTTT-C14). Este ltimo j foi demonstrado em transistores de filmes finos (TFTs) com elevada mobilidade dos portadores. Diversos solventes tm sido usados para dissolv-lo, sendo o 1,2- dichlorobenzene (DCB) um dos mais empregados. Filmes finos podem ser obtidos por diferentes tcnicas de deposio, tal como drop casting, spin coating, serigrafia e impresso a jato de tinta. Os esforos de muitos nos ltimos 20 anos tm sido direcionados compreenso e aperfeioamento das interfaces como consequncia das condies de processamento. Estudos morfolgicos em filmes de PBTTT-C14 tm por fim analisar a estrutura molecular e a formao de cadeias estendidas, correlacionando-as com os parmetros eltricos do TFT
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Organic electronics has currently become an important competitor to electronics based on a-Si. A wide variety of materials has been synthesized to improve the performance of organic-based devices. Versatility, low-cost, and large-area are interesting features for applications such as displays, photovoltaics, and sensors. Most of the semiconducting polymers are solution processed, such as poly(2,5-bis(3-tetradecyl-thiophen-2-yl)thieno[3,2- b]thiophene) (PBTTT). The latter was already demonstrated in high-mobility thin-film transistors (TFTs). Among several solvents, dichlorobenzene (DCB) is widely-used to dissolve PBTTT. Thin films can be obtained by different deposition techniques such as drop casting, spin coating, screen printing, and inkjet printing. Research efforts in the last 20 years have been directed towards the understanding and correlating interfaces with processing conditions. Morphological studies of PBTTT films to analyze the molecular structure and the formation of extended chains can be responsible for improving TFT performance.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: TRANSISTOR DE FILME FINO ORGNICO BOTTOM GATE BOTTOM CONTACT PARA ANLISE DE QUALIDADE DA GUA
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: BOTTOM GATE POLYMER FIELD EFFECT TRANSISTOR FOR WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENT

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Impactos das Tecnologias na Engenharia de Materiais e Metalrgica 2

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A habitao irregular e, consequentemente, o despejo de esgoto em reservatrios de gua do estado de So Paulo acarretam a proliferao de algas. Aps sua decomposio, estas liberam substncias que causam sabor e odor gua. Dentre as possveis solues para sua deteco, destacam-se dispositivos eletrnicos a partir de semicondutores orgnicos. Ultimamente, uma grande variedade de materiais orgnicos tem sido sintetizada visando melhorar o desempenho dos dispositivos eletrnicos. Esta eletrnica de baixo custo e grandes reas possui os recursos necessrios para aplicao em sensores. Dentre os materiais orgnicos processados por soluo, destacam-se o semicondutor PBTTT e o dieltrico PVP. Ambos j foram utilizados na fabricao de transistores de filmes finos (TFTs) com elevada mobilidade dos portadores de carga. Geralmente, depositados por spin coating para obteno de filmes finos. Nesse contexto, este trabalho teve por objetivo o desenvolvimento de TFTs de PBTTT para anlise de gua da Companhia de Saneamento Bsico do Estado de So Paulo (SABESP). Estudos estruturais e morfolgicos foram realizados com o objetivo de reticular o dieltrico e melhorar os parmetros eltricos de TFTs bottom gate bottom contact para, enfim, permitir a deteco de lcoois.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Irregular housing and, consequently, the discharge of sewage in water reservoirs in the state of So Paulo lead to algae proliferation. After their decomposition, they release substances that cause flavor and odor to the water. Among the possible solutions for its detection, electronic devices from organic semiconductors stand out. Lately, a wide variety of organic materials have been synthesized to improve the performance of electronic devices. This low cost and large area electronics has the necessary resources for application in sensors. Among the organic materials processed by solution, the semiconductor PBTTT and the dielectric PVP stand out. Both have already been used in the manufacture of thin film transistors (TFTs) with high mobility of charge carriers. Generally, deposited by spin coating to obtain thin films. In this context, this work aimed to develop PBTTT TFTs for water analysis by the Basic Sanitation Company of the State of So Paulo (SABESP). Structural and morphological studies were carried out with the objective of crosslinking the dielectric and improving the electrical parameters of bottom gate bottom contact TFTs to, finally, allow the detection of alcohols.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A Eletrnica Orgnica importante porque ela oferece semicondutores, tcnicas de deposio de baixo custo e aplicao em massa. Os Transistores de Filmes Finos Orgnicos (OTFTs em ingls) podem ser fabricados em vidro ou plstico, substratos que oferecem uma alternativa de baixo custo e diversas aplicaes, uma delas sendo o sensoramiento. Existem outros dispositivos que consistem de grandes matrizes e circuitos complexos, aumentando o custo de construo e a dificuldade de trabalhar com eles; sensores de gs a base de OTFTs oferecem uma alternativa de baixo custo para construo de narizes eletrnicos, fazendo eles mais baratos e simples de usar. O objetivo deste projeto testar o desempenho do dispositivo e como ele responde a exposio a compostos orgnicos volteis (VOCs em ingls), testando a sensibilidade e especificidade do sensor.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Organic Electronics is an important branch because it offers semiconductors, low cost deposition techniques and mass application. Organic Thin Film Transistors (OTFTs) can be fabricated in glass or plastic, substrates that offer low cost alternative and diverse applications, one of them being sensing. Other devices for sensing exist in the market, consisting of big matrixes and complex circuits, bringing up the construction cost and making it harder to work with them; gas sensors based from OTFTs offer a low cost alternative for the construction or electronic noses (e-nose), making them affordable and easy to use. The objective for this project is to test how the device performs when exposed to volatile organic compounds (VOCs), testing the sensibility and specificity of the sensor.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: PID2562-2020 - Caracterizao eltrica de transistores orgnicos flexveis automatizada
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: Caracterizao eltrica de transistores orgnicos flexveis automatizada

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Os transistores de filme fino orgnico (OTFTs) tm chamado muita ateno nos ltimos anos devido sua grande rea e capacidade de processamento em baixa temperatura. Dispositivos comerciais que usam materiais orgnicos esto entrando sistematicamente no mercado. Devido s grandes melhorias no desempenho e estabilidade eltrica, os semicondutores orgnicos (OSCs) abriram uma nova era de aplicaes eletrnicas de baixo custo e grandes reas, como telas flexveis, etiquetas de identificao por radiofrequncia, eletrnicos txteis e sensores. Alm de uma crescente demanda global por aparelhos pequenos, portteis e baratos, principalmente para diagnstico mdico in-situ, monitoramento ambiental e alimentar, entrega de medicamentos, deteco de armas qumicas e biolgicas e para a confeco de narizes e lnguas eletrnicos. Neste contexto, o objetivo deste projeto est no desenvolvimento de um processo de caracterizao eltrica de transistores flexveis a partir de filmes finos orgnicos e sua posterior automao.
A inovao consiste na aplicao em OTFTs de semicondutores sintetizados e fornecidos por nossos colaboradores cientficos. O estudo consistiu em uma investigao para otimizar o desempenho do dispositivo e torn-lo mecanicamente flexvel.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Organic Thin-Film Transistors (OTFTs) have caught a lot of attention through recent years due to their large area and low temperature processing capabilities. Commercial devices which use organic materials are systematically entering the market. Due to major improvements in electrical performance and stability, organic semiconductors (OSCs) have opened an entire new era of low cost and large area electronic applications, such as flexible displays, radio-frequency identification tags, textile electronics and sensors. In addition to a growing global demand for small, portable and cheap gadgets, mainly for in-situ medical diagnosis, environmental and food monitoring, drug delivery, chemical and biological weapons detection, and for the confection of electronic noses and tongues. In this context, the objective of this project lies in the development of a process of electrical characterization of flexible transistors from organic thin-films and their later automation.
The innovation consists in the application in OTFTs of semiconductors synthesized and provided from our scientific collaborators. The study was composed of an investigation to optimize device performance and make it mechanically flexible.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Desenvolvimento de diodos orgnicos emissores de luz por blade coating
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Development of organic light-emitting diodes by blade coating

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Organic light-emitting diodes (OLEDs) have been widely used in displays and lighting sources in several commercial products. These are in general manufactured by methods of physical vapor deposition (PVD) of small molecules that requires the use of vacuum chambers, and in general have high cost and low yield. Thus, the development of methods for depositing organic materials in solution has been pursued. Blade coating consists in the formation of a meniscus between the solution, the blade and the substrate followed by its drag resulting in the deposition of a thin film of material on a surface. This is a promising alternative for the deposition of organic material layers not only for OLEDs but also for other types of organic electronic devices such as organic solar cells and thin film transistors. In this work, two automated systems for thin film deposition by blade coating were developed. One system presents two heating sources for fast solvent removal and the other is a compact system that can be easily inserted and used within an inert glovebox environment. These systems were successfully used to coat nanometric thickness thin films of organic semiconductor materials commonly used as hole injection layer (HIL), hole transport layer (HTL) and emissive layer (EML) in OLED devices. Thin films of PEDOT:PSS deposited by blade coating presented good uniformity and low roughness, similar to spin-coated films. OLED devices with PEDOT:PSS HIL deposited by both methods presented similar efficiency and lifetime, however, blade coating shows as advantages, the elimination of the process step for glass-ITO substrate surface treatment with O2 RIE plasma and the use of 15 times less solution volume than the volume required for the spin coating deposition. The effect of coating methods was also investigated for the HTL and EML layers. Transient photoluminescence measurements (TrPL) showed that blade-coated films have longer exciton lifetimes than spin-coated films, indicating tha

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Estudo de sensores baseados em luminescncia eletroqumica
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Estudo de sensores baseados em luminescncia eletroqumica

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Desenvolvimento de um Sistema Embarcado para Gesto Energtica em Baixa Tenso pelo Lado da Demanda
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Development of an embedded system for low voltage energy management on the demand side

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Por meio da pesquisa bibliogrfica, observa-se que grande parte do desenvolvimento recente na rea de eficincia energtica e sustentabilidade est relacionado com IoT (Internet of Things), Smart Home, Smart Building e Smart Grid. reas que esto interligadas atravs do desenvolvimento de Smart Energy Meters. Por tanto, considerando a necessidade apresentada pela pesquisa e a disponibilidade do padro de consumo de energia em tempo real, essencial para perceber e compreender oportunidades de economia de energia. Neste contexto, este estudo prope o desenvolvimento de um sistema embarcado para realizar a medio, o monitoramento de consumo e o controle de cargas possibilitando a melhoria da eficincia energtica nos sistemas de energia pela gesto realizada pelo lado da demanda. Um medidor inteligente mede eletronicamente o consumo e, outros parmetros em um determinado intervalo de tempo e transmite as medies por uma rede de comunicao para o usurio consumidor. Essas informaes so visualizadas em gadgets, informando os usurios sobre seu consumo de energia e os custos relacionados possibilitando o controle e a gesto completa sobre a carga. Para o desenvolvimento do prottipo, ser utilizado um sistema de avaliao do circuito de medio de energia monofsico altamente preciso e com autocalibrao em conjunto com um microcontrolador equipado com comunicao sem fio. A validao ser realizada atravs do sistema de avaliao do fabricante do circuito integrado, e o desenvolvimento do projeto eletrnico ser realizado posteriormente. De forma a atingir grande integrao do chip de medio com os demais dispositivos possibilitando a produo do prottipo. Os resultados obtidos com o prottipo produzido sero comparados com valores de medidores convencionais para avalio da preciso obtida que deve apresentar resultados dentro das especificaes de tolerncia exigidas.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Through bibliographic research, it is observed that much of the recent development in the area of energy efficiency and sustainability is related to IoT (Internet of Things), Smart Home, Smart Building and Smart Grid. Areas that are interconnected through the development of Smart Energy Meters. Therefore, considering the need presented by the research and the availability of the energy consumption pattern in real time is essential to perceive and understand opportunities for energy savings, this study proposes the development of an embedded system to perform the measurement and the monitoring of consumption, as well as the load control, enabling the improvement of energy efficiency in energy systems by management on the demand side. A smart meter electronically measures consumption and other parameters over a given period of time and transmits the measurements over a communication network to the consumer user. This information is displayed on gadgets, informing users about their energy consumption and related costs, enabling complete control and management of the load. For the development of the prototype, a highly accurate, self-calibrating single-phase energy measurement circuit evaluation system will be used together with a microcontroller equipped with wireless communication. The validation will be carried out through the evaluation system of the manufacturer of the integrated circuit, and the development of the electronic project will be carried out later. In order to achieve great integration of the measurement chip with the other devices enabling the production of the prototype. The results obtained with the prototype will be compared to conventional meter values to assess the precision obtained, which should present results within the required tolerance specifications.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO: Comparison of the energy markets of Colombia and Brazil
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PARTICIPACAO-EM-BANCA-D.TITULO-INGLES: Comparison of the energy markets of Colombia and Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a description and comparison of the electricity markets of Colombia and Brazil. First of all, a study of the institutional structures and free and regulated trade environments of both Colombia and Brazil is carried out, as well as the regulated user ratings and the composition of the final prices given to these consumers according to the category to which they belong and how the evolution of these tariff values in both countries has been, regarding to the free environment, the prices of the most recent auctions of these countries are verified. The economic implications that it represents for consumers are then evaluated, belonging to the free or regulated environment in Colombia and Brazil. Moving from the internal comparison through these countries, an analysis between them is carried out, in which it is shown how the stipulated taxes also generate a marked differentiation between the values paid by the consumers of electric energy of the mentioned countries.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents a description and comparison of the electricity markets of Colombia and Brazil. The economic implications that it represents for consumers are then evaluated, belonging to the free or regulated environment in Colombia and Brazil. Moving from the internal comparison through these countries, an analysis between them is carried out, in which it is shown how the stipulated taxes also generate a marked differentiation between the values paid by the consumers of electric energy of the mentioned countries.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Elabora-se um plano para atingir a auto-suficincia energtica no campus da USP por meio da utilizao de painis solares. O estudo conta com a anlise dos aspectos tcnicos e financeiros envolvidos na implementao de tal projeto atravs de pesquisas sobre projetos similares e da abordagem do problema especificamente para o campus da USP. Os aspectos jurdicos e de financiamento tambm so levados em considerao, sendo feita uma anlise acerca da possvel localizao dos painis nas dependncias do campus universitrio.
